name: Cuartel de Santo Domingo
description: Cuartel de Santo Domingo is dubbed as the Santa Rosa Intramuros or the Santa Rosa Forth Santiago. The fort was constructed in 1877, and it served as the headquarters of "Guardia civil" to protect the town against bandits. During the revolution period, the Spanish have used this forth against the army of Gen. Emilio Aguinaldo in 1897. It also plays an important role during the Japanese occupation where it was used as a refugee camp from Cabuyao and Calamba. Later, it was used by the Philippine Army in 1957, and then, it is now being used by the Philippine National Police in 1992.
commute: Getting into this area is takes some rides. First, go to Balibago Complex (bus terminal) and find a tricycle terminal near Target Mall or at Victory Mall and ask the driver to drop you at Santa Rosa Nuvalli. Then, take a walk or ride another tricycle to reach the site.
address: Brgy. Sto Domingo, Santa Rosa, Laguna
